Reviews.Title: “Truly relaxing...”
Reviews.Author: Kate G
Reviews.Content: We own a week timeshare in March and have been at the beach house 5 times over the last 11 years. We love the craziness of downtown but to spend the afternoon in the pool or on the dock really is a wonderful way to relax. Locations both in shade and sun to give everyone what they need. The little tiki hut serves some drinks (wish it had a bit more snack food). The condos are spacious, spotless and lovely. The screened lanai is our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Tampawolverine
Reviews.Content: Very nice relaxing location right when you enter Key West. Good place to bring children away from Duval St. Zero-entry pool provided ample shade and sun for whatever you desired.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place to getaway from the Key West party scene”
Reviews.Author: EJBaum
Reviews.Content: The Key West of nostalgia - quiet beaches and images of "Margaritaville" solitude - does not really exist anymore. The place has become a tourist mecca with all the commercial trappings that you would expect. But, when you are staying at the Hyatt Beach House Resort, you have the closest thing I can imagine of what it used to be like. The room's size and furnishings are superb. The suite is well insulated for sound and the kitchen is fully stocked for cooking (you really want to do that while you're on vacation???) as well as for margarita making! The building arrangement allows each suite to have a scenic view. Having a heated pool, hot tub, small beach, and Tiki bar all within reach of each other allows you to spend hours relaxing on site. The only down-side is the close proximity to US Route 1 which seems to have traffic flowing 22 hours a day. While not overly distracting you will hear motors racing and sirens wailing throughout your day.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a quieter stay”
Reviews.Author: elgmar
Reviews.Content: So when traveling to Key West I always try and stay off Duval because to enjoy the island atmosphere, one needs to relax away from the hustle and bustle. I find myself down there every night, but during the day one needs a nice beach. That is where this resort starts. A private beach, something quite rare on Key West. The Beach goes right into the pool area, which is again very relaxing. Ask for buildings A or F, but do not be disappointed with the others(we stayed in B12 and B23). Also ask for the third level, as the view is better. I traveled with my in-laws and we had two couple and two singles in the party. We ended up getting two units and each couple had the suite, while each single stayed in the guest queen room. The room isn't huge, but are adequate. The kitchens worked well for breakfasts, lunches, and one dinner. The most underrated part of the place is the screened in porch. I don't know if either party actually closed the patio doors at night, because you didn't worry about critters. The master suite is huge, nice whirlpool and shower. This is my second time to Key West and the next time I come, I plan on returning. I would highly recommend this place. Message me if you have any further questions.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: KingofMorgantown
Reviews.Content: This was a great 2 bedroom with a pool view. It was almost in Stock Island, so it was away from a lot of the action. That's what I was looking for with my wife and 2 young childrem

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Paulette Y
Reviews.Content: The suite of rooms we had were awesome. We had 5 women and had plenty of space to spread out and relax. The downside that I would mention is we had no visit from house keeping and had to wash our own towels. The concierge never seemed to be there. We went down a couple of nights to ask about places for dinner and he was always gone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place & DON'T miss meeting Mike at the Tiki Bar by the pool!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler49Texas
Reviews.Content: We like this quiet end of town. Suites are very nice and the screened porches are so relaxing. One wonderful find this trip was Mike the bartender at the Hotel Tiki bar by the pool. He is not your usual bartender. He's very well versed on the Key West area and has great restaurant suggestions...he will even make your reservations. He is a master mixologist! Try his signature Sangria or Bloody Mary's.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: amber w
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend here with two friends, had a wonderful experience. The property is beautiful and beyond relaxing. It is quiet and peaceful so a nice getaway from the craziness of the island! Hotel offers a shuttle to Key west proper for $5 per person. Takes about 10-15 minutes depending on traffice. The tiki hut was our daily "Cheers". Jim was our bartender and he went above and beyond in his service to ensure we had a great time. Made our dinner recommendations and reservations, handled our boat rental and made us remarkable, and different, mojitos every day! Overall great experience and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Artistjt
Reviews.Content: It was a great resort. Very quite and is off of the main drag from traffic. You can take the shuttle for 5 bucks to their other location near Duval Street and get 20% off at the restaurants and spas at the other Hyatt. The pool and beach area is great and the Tiki bar makes great drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, grounds and rooms”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTraveling2
Reviews.Content: This place is great all around. It is 4 miles from town which allowed me a healthy bike ride each day. The resort is on the water, has sunning area in the sand and near a pool. The jacuzzi in the master bedroom is large enough for 2...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the sand and the lounge chairs, but units need cleaning”
Reviews.Author: fsujarv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Beach House from 12/25/11 - 1/1/12. This was our second trip to Key West in recent years and included our children ages 17 and 14. On our previous trip to Key West, we stayed at the Hyatt Windward Point which is located about a mile and a half from the Hyatt Beach House. Upon checking in, our location was in the D wing which is nearest the resort office. The view from the screen patio was rather limited as we could basically see the back of the office and the walkway leading to the pool. After unpacking our bags, we noticed that the unit had not been properly cleaned before our arrival. We made a couple of visits to the front desk to bring this to their attention and they offered us a room in the A wing, which had a much better view as it was closer to the sand and water. I would say the rooms at the resort are just average, but the grounds are very nice if you are looking to relax near the pool and the sand. The area rug in our unit was fairly dirty, and it was apparent that the tile flooring had not been thouroughly cleaned in quite some time. That being said, we enjoyed eating meals on the screen porch and the beds were fairly comfortable. It was also nice having a washer and dryer in the unit. A few comparisons based on our previous stay at Windward Pointe. If you are looking for a nicer room, I would give Windward Pointe the edge. If you are looking for relaxation near the pool, I would give the Beach House the nod. The pool area at Windward Pointe is nice, but the traffic from A1A runs right next to the pool area. The only sand at Windward Pointe is confined to the beach volleyball court and there is a sea wall on the other side of A1A. The man-made beach at the Beach House was located between the water and the pool. It covers a large area and you are able to walk directly from the sand into the pool. The lounge chairs on the beach were incredibly comfortable and there was no traffic noise. There was also less air traffic to contend with at the Beach House. Windward Pointe is located next to the airport. There wasn't a lot of activity at the resort, but that was fine with us. We were able to drive 5-10 minutes to Duval St. if we wanted to check out the shops and restaurants. One note if you head downtown -- take some change with you. We received a $25 parking ticket at 11:33 P.M. Key West apparently monitors its meters until midnight. The Hyatt Beach House is a great place to stay if you are looking for some relaxation away from the craziness of Duval St. and downtown Key West. If you are traveling to Key West to experience the bar scene, you will likely wish to be located closer to the Duval St. area.

Reviews.Title: “best resort we ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: maxyin
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this location in Dec 2011. I have to say each of our family truly enjoyed this place. The property is clean and close to water. We rented a 2 bedrooms suite, it is spacious, has a huge balcony from there you can see yacht/boat on ocean, My 9 and 10 years old enjoyed playing in pool. It's about 3-4 miles from Keywest downtown, so it' not too far all action. It's bit expensive but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: kedls25
Reviews.Content: This is a timeshare location and all units are facing the Gulf of Mexico with water and pool views. The room was clean upon check - in, something we sometimes have an issue with in Key West. The staff was friendly and helpful. We brought a kayak with us and they even help us secure the kayak. We thought they had a kayak rack, but they no longer have the rack. They locked the kayak up for us in a store room. We eventually purchases a bicyle lock and locked it to bike rack. We did use the kayak, it was easily launched from their small beach. It is shallow and perfect for kayaking, they are surronded by mangroves and it was great to kayak in the mornings. They also have a dock and our son went fishing several times right from the dock. Several people caught snapper from the dock and the fishing seemed decent. There is also a Tiki Hut with water sport rentals and also a bar with food. You can also store, dock and launch a small boat. The hotel does have trailer parking for small to mid-sized boats. It did not appear to have any specific policy for docking of boats. The room was a 1100 square foot, 2 bedrrom, 2 bath unit. It had an enclosed balcony that was very pleasant to have breakfast and to enjoy reading a book. I was missing a few items in the kitchen, a non-stick frying pan and then a deep baking dish for a turkey. They front desk brought all items to our room with a quick phone call. This is a self catering location, they did a mid-week clean with a towel and sheet change. They do have daily housekeeping for a fee, but it is really not needed. The only thing I wish they had on site is a work out room. You can use the one at the Hyatt hotel downtown, but it also is very small and not really worth the trouble of going down there. We did not have much trouble driving down to Duval or to the marina for dinner or excursions. You can also rent bikes for the day or the entire week. This would also be an accpetable means of travel. They do have a shuttle, but there is a fee involved and we had a car, so we did not use their transportation services. The units are as pictured and I we will be returning to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: kitkat94
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely facility. Clean, well maintained, and the staff was great. The only problem I had with this facility was the location. Really would have preferred something closer to Duval St. It is definitely a long walk to anyplace - but did find Key West easy to get around with a vehicle, so it wasn't a major issue. I expect at busier times of the year, parking would be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Key West lodging.”
Reviews.Author: Akbpf
Reviews.Content: Good location, but plan to bike, scooter, or taxi to downtown unless you are are into long walks. Rooms are 2 bdrm "condos" with kitchens, all appliances, utensils, laundry, etc. A quick run to the grocery store allows you to save quite a bit by not eating "out" for every meal. They even have several propane BBQs available for guests as well (big bonus). The rooms, grounds, and pool are well maintained and very clean. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “High expectations, but it didn't live up to them.”
Reviews.Author: huckleberries
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is clean, the staff is great, but the place is just noisy. Whether its the guy talking on his cell phone at 3 am in the screen porch below or the party across the pool going on from midnight to 4 am or the hot tub scene at 11 pm (quiet hours are from 10 pm to 6 am). Just not a very quiet place, even between the floors. The pillows in both rooms (see below) were cheap and over used. it took 2 to make a pillow and even that was poor. On the plus side we got into a room that had obviously been smoked in for an extended period of time. I asked to move that night and the next day we were moved by the staff to a better location without the lingering smoke smell. The screen porches are great for relaxing, but at night it was probably better to run the AC rather than leave the windows and porch open.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: staffb
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare for this resort.We arrived on the first day after the hotel was closed for slow season(2wks.in Sept.)Everything was spotless and fresh.The staff were all very friendly,never had to wait for anything if we needed it.The rooms are all 2BR/2 BA with lovely screened in porches(the flies and mosquitos were kept out).It was nice every morning to relax with our first cup of coffee and in the afternoons with our bloody mary's. It is located 2 miles from the airport and 3-4 miles from downtown.There are 3 Hyatt's on the island and guest have use of all 3.The location downtown has the gym,spa and restaurant,however located in a very congested area.The advantage to it would be walking to everywhere you needed,but I would think be noisy at night. We rented a car(however the upgrade was to a crown victoria,wrong car to have in this town). Get a small to mid sized car,since parking is difficult.Cost of parking is $10/3hrs most places.Some restaurants have free parking while dining only,allowing 1-1.5hrs at a time.The transportation from hotel in shuttle is $5/pp one way and taxi is $7/pp one way.Car was a little over $200/wk. Speaking of restaurants,we never had a bad meal.2 Friends is located near Duval St.and the food is delicious.The best conch and keylime pie that we ate.We also tried the cuban food at El Meson de Pepe,located at Mallory Square.Meal was great,homemade Sangria was good, great Mojito's, and large portions of food.On our last night we ate at Alonzo's on the wharf.The snapper New Orleans was fantastic(my husband wished he had ordered that) and our friend ate the Coconut fried Grouper which was also very good. There are 3 main (chain) grocery stores on the island all within 1mile of each other,Public,Albertsons and Winn Dixie.We shopped mainly at Albertson's as the prices were close to our prices at home.Beer and wine are available there and there is a liquor store 2 doors down for anything they don't have.These are located 1-2 miles from the resort. The one thing we would not do again is Lloyds Bicycle trip,pretty boring and rode for over 2 hrs with no offer of a water,and the price of $35 is way too much.At best should be a $20/pp trip. As for beaches,there are not many,2 near the airport have nice sand but were supposed to be closed to swimmers due to bacteria(noticed a few people in water but not many).We did go to Fort Zachary Taylor state park(admission $2/pp) and it was quite nice.We would wear water socks if we went back as the sand is very coarse and it is rocky for about 2-3 feet into the water.It seemed like this is where most of the locals went.We did try to snorkel but visibilty was poor on the day we were there.Very nice picnic and shady areas here great for families. We would return to Key West and would definitelty stay at the same resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ninna1534
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare for this one. It was GREAT. It was just my husband and I and we just wanted to relax. The Room was clean and plenty big enough,had everything there we needed.Got there early,and they got our room clean right away.EVERYONE was helpful and so nice.We would stay here again for sure.Our room was A13.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: DF0403
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7 day stay.This was an Interval exchange. The room (A12) was comfortable and had a fully equipped kitchen, dining area, 2 bedrooms and a living area. The screened-in balcony was nicely furnished and offered a limited waterview. The master bedroom had a whirlpool bath and clear glass shower stall. No privacy here so if you're traveling with others, lock the door behind you.There is one pool. The deepest part is only 4 feet and gets crowded at times. The so called beach is a typical man-made Key West beach. If you stay here, travel a half hour north to the beaches of Bahia Honda State Park.The high speed internet is free but the signal in my room was weak.Staff is not very friendly. There is nothing much to do in this resort. The only places within walking distance are Waffle House and a bar/restaurant called Hurricane Hole. Duval St. is a 10-15 minute drive. This was not worth the exhange fee and yearly maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: DrewV2820
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife, brother-in-law and his girlfriend. The rooms were the perfect size for us and the screened in porch was a nice touch. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The hotel is a few miles from Duval Street so if you don't mind driving or taking a cab to go out at night it's a perfect hotel. The pool is nice and there is a small bar to order drinks. We did some fishing off the dock and did catch some small fish.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family resort.”
Reviews.Author: cnstiefel
Reviews.Content: We will definitely go back soon! The whole family loved the spacious condo. The kids had their own bedroom and bathroom and we had the master bedroom with an oversized tub and separate shower. The huge screened in porch was perfect for chilling with a cocktail or eating breakfast. Kids loved the pool and we enjoyed watching sunsets from the boat dock.

Reviews.Title: “Bad for the Money-Shoudy Rooms for a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: gajone
Reviews.Content: The room was not ready when we got there. They made us wait for almost two hours. Did not offer any refreshments while we waited. When we did get our room the chairs were dirty and stained. The bath room sink was cracked. Not enough toliet paper in the room. Very dated looking . They did not even give you a cheap pen and paper to write down a note or phone number. The floor was even dirty. The room had a very nice view of the ocean, with what they called a privite balcony which is right next to the out side stair way. Make sure you close the shades when you go potty otherwise you are in full view of anyone on the stairs. The pool was a joke it was nothing more the a 3ft deep kiddie pool. Most Of the staff was very nice except on check in. Way too much money for the quality. Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: JtotheCov
Reviews.Content: Very laid back. Good location away from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street. High marks for Giovanni the concierge. He was knowledgeable, friendly and super helpful. This location needs a Gym and better situated Tiki Bar. It was a hassle to have to drive downtown to use a less than adequate "fitness" center.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Go Wrong - Great Family Location”
Reviews.Author: izzamracop
Reviews.Content: WOW..... Really loved this resort / timeshare property and Key West in general exceeded my expectations. Looked at many of the hotels in Key West and thought the Hyatt Beach House was the perfect place for us. Traveled with my two older kids so the separate bedrooms and full kitchen made things work out perfectly. Not a resort (room service, restaurant, valet, etc) but has a resort feel with the water views, beach style pool and Tiki Hut Bar. Great Key West feel! 10 mins from downtown / Duvall but it work out great for us as it was an easy drive and I thought parking was a breeze. Most the time we parked free at the Hyatt Key West. If you're going as a couple or with couples, I would probably stay at one of hotels closer to town, with a family I can't see anything else being better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: jingersnap
Reviews.Content: Condo style rooms offer all the comforts of home and plenty of room. We vacationed with 4 adults and 3 kids (age 10,11 & 12). All rooms face the pool area, which is nice. Kids could come and go with no worries. The view of the sunset from the hotel pier was beautiful and way better than Mallory Square. Gas grills on the "beach" area worked great. The pool is really nice with big palm trees to look up at. My brother and my boys snorkeled around the pier and found a horseshoe crab! The only ocean views are from the condos in buildings D and F I think. I didn't ask but it seemed that the condos in building F are bigger...maybe 3 bedrooms...because the screened porch was bigger. Speaking of screened porches, I enjoyed sleeping out on mine one night! I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very nice stay with a few concerns”
Reviews.Author: DaysInDallas
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West and we loved the idea of 2 completely separate bedrooms and bathrooms, with a sofa bed for our family with teenage boy and girl. The property was overall very attractive, with gorgeous sand but the "beachfront" was very tiny, pictures can be deceiving. Swimming not really practical at all. The small pier was a great place to view gorgeous sunsets. The pool was very relaxing, but extremely shallow. We probably should know by now not to assume a sofa bed will be decent, and this one was worthless with a saggy, springy, torn mattress. I am a stickler for cleanliness, considering the property was over 200. per night, and the floor was dirty with long hairs all over it. It took 2 attempts to get housekeeping to bring a working vacuum and the idea of them not having vacuumed properly in the 1st place gave me the creeps. Other than that, the condo and grounds were great, and I liked being on the quiet side of Key West. You will need a car if you plan to go off the property. Another word to the wise---I didn't know this was one of those time-share properties. I thought the desk staff was very rude and cold when we checked in, all except the concierge, Giovanni, who is AWESOME. Anyway, I observed the desk clerks being very friendly to other guests, and I guess they treat their timeshare owners differently. Overall, it was a decent value, and I would have loved it so much more if not for the nasty floor, which was remedied..

Reviews.Title: “Shouldn't be your first choice!”
Reviews.Author: rengle9
Reviews.Content: Due to making a last minute decision to drive down to Key West, and the fact we needed a two bedroom suite, Hyatt was about our only viable option. With that said, we arrived at 4:15, with a 4pm check-in time to be informed our room was still dirty and would be ready soon. We waited and at 5pm we were told it wouldn't be ready for some time. They offered us another room and we checked in. The rooms are old and worn out. They need to be updated and painted, etc. They were clean. First thing we noticed was the ants crawling all over the kitchen counter top and walls. We called and a maintenance guy showed up and sprayed, problem solved. Unfortunately our neighbors decided to stay up most of the night hanging out on the patio making noise. The room is a nice size and would be great for a family with small children. The grounds and pool are average at best. No ocean view from the majority of the rooms. No real beach to speak of and very limited shade to protect yourself from the sun. The resort is at the far Northern end of the island, about 4 miles from Front street. Traffic is usually crowded on the island so you will spend a lot of time running back and forth. You will need a car! Don't rely on a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great facillity and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: hartfilledangel
Reviews.Content: Great facility and the staff are super accomidating. Only complaint really no beach but that's pretty much the deal for Key West in general no beach. Dry tortugas great place to visit while in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay - We would come back.”
Reviews.Author: GSi_Bailey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Key West and we stayed at the Hyatt Beach House Resort. Nicely appointed with the white shutters and trim. Grounds and area kept very clean. A/C worked well and was needed! Ceiling fans were a godsend. Two bedrooms and two baths - master was nice with a huge bathroom including sunken jacuzzi-type tub and a separate glass shower stall. Double sink. Pocket door to toilet. Plenty of closet and drawer space. Drawbacks: Not much privacy - double doors closed off the family room. TVs are kind of small and not flat=panelled. (Sorry, I've gotten used to the HD large TVs in many hotels and home). Kitchen was nice (no stove which could be a plus for some people). Microwave, dishwasher, full sized refrigerator with ice maker was great. No garbage disposal. The pool area was nice - lounge chairs and beach towels were provided. Pool felt like bath water - seriously about80 degrees. Comfortable but not really refreshing. Drink service by the pool was inconsistent but I often walked to the Tiki Hut myself (hey Jimmy!) when thirsty. The beach area was small but they do have docks for small boats. The front staff was nice and very accommodating. We would definitely stay here again if we came back to the Key West area.

Reviews.Title: “Best of 3 Hyatt Vacation Clubs on Key West”
Reviews.Author: tracirush
Reviews.Content: As a Hyatt Vacation Club owner we were unsure which property to stay at for our first time visit to Key West. We ultimately picked Beach House for the man-made beach, being directly on the water and lagoon style pool. Although the rooms are slightly dated, the property was quaint and intimate and kept the authentic feeling of "old key west". Although their is no real beach, you can swim in the bay right off of the dock and you have a beautiful view at sunset. The manmade beach with the comfy beach beds were a nice treat and the zero entry pool was a hit with kids. The grills are all propane and maintained very well - although we never used them, we saw several families cooking dinner while watching the sun set. Although the property claims wireless internet, it is extremely slow, so plan on being hardwired if you need to do any work. Our ethernet cable was broken in our room and they did not have a replacement, but it wasn't a major problem considering we were on vacation and didn't really need internet access. Our A/C did break the last night and hotel management moved us to another room while still allowing us to keep all of our stuff in our original room since we were moving out in the morning. The property is about 15 minutes from Duvall but with a young daughter, we appreciated being able to get away from the crowds in the evenings. If traveling with small children, get off of Duval before 7pm. We did tour the other two properties. Wynward Pointe is the newest and although the interiors are much nicer, it felt a little sterile - we could have been anywhere. They do have a great ocean view but you have to cross the road to get to the ocean and even then it is not a "beach". You would have to bike or drive about 2 miles down to get to Smathers Beach. The other property, Sunset Harbour, was the original Hyatt Vacation club - and although the location is perfect for adults wanting to enjoy the town, shopping, bars and dining, the property is extremely antiquated. We did visit the Hyatt hotel at the Marina and it was beautiful. Definitely go by for a drink at happy hour (2 for 1) and dinner at Shor was very nice (beautiful sunset). If my husband and I were traveling by ourselves, we would probably stay at this property (staying within the Hyatt family) - however with children - staying at Beach House with the full kitchen, only 72 units, and great pool is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Snobby staff, old buildings, loud grounds, no maintenance, out of the way timeshare”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlustprof
Reviews.Content: Imagine if you will, arriving at your hotel to find a staff that is too busy to actually care for guests. Then you go to a room with wallpaper peeling and a toilet that smells of urine. Finally, as you go to your room there is a loud party at the pool with plenty of alcohol, and then you try to drift off to sleep only to hear outside your window a sound that resembles an angry goat trying to clear his throat. This is the Beach House Resort in Key West (provided you define in Key West as just over the bridge nowhere near the beach, Duvall Street, any historical site, or pretty much anything of interest (unless you like looking at naval housing/offices across the street. The pool looks large, but is half zero entry (i.e., you cannot swim there) and half only 3 feet deep (you cannot swim there). You could go sit on the nearby swing as long as you don't object to LOTS of mildew. You also cannot swim on the "beach" because it isn't one. It's a lot of sand by a canal or something. I cannot imagine how they got people to buy into this timeshare-err vacation ownership property nor what they did with all those maintenance fees. They certainly did not seem to go into maintaining anything.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenmisstx
Reviews.Content: We stayed with three kids.. Three adults.. It is far away from Duval Street so the upside is you wont have to deal with the noise. Driving is a pain though not fault of hotel just Key West.. We ate at 4Friends and Jimmy Buffet. Great food. The Outback steakhouse is also great. Nice clean. Now back to hotel. NIce Pool, Nice clean beach area. The water though is shallow. I would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: chopperkat
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed 5 nights at the Hyatt Beach House Resort in Key West in May 2011. Our room had 2 large bathrooms. There was a huge jacuzzi tub in the larger bathroom. The bedrooms were good sized with plenty of space for storage-drawers and closets with hangers. The kitchen was fully equipped as advertised and we were happy to find that there was also a blender for some fruity beverages! We spent a lot of time on the screened porch in the evenings. It was large and had plenty of room for everyone to sit as well as a table. The pool area and grounds were tropical and beautiful! There were floating rafts for guests to use, which we did. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and did a great job cleaning every day. We had other family members who stayed at the resort as well. When I made the reservation I requested two rooms next to each other and our request was granted. I definitely would stay here again. The resort is not by Duval street so if you do not have a rental car or want to be right in the middle of everything, this might be a little too far for you. However, it only takes about 10-15 minutes to get to Duval street (due to stop lights and traffic). There is also no restaurant on site, but we did order delivery a couple of times, otherwise, there are so many great places to eat in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Facilities great; service poor”
Reviews.Author: triptakermtn2009
Reviews.Content: The building is very beautiful and kept up well. The service is not what I would have expected for the amount of money I paid. My unit had not been stocked up with supplies. I found hairs in the bathroom and on the towels. The location of the building is far away from Duval street. It appears that the employees have not been trained on giving customer service. They were border line rude. Did not even say thank you when I was checking out. Or asked me how my stay was. I paid almost 300 a night to stay there and I expected better service than that.

Reviews.Title: “This place was AMAZING and so worth the cost!!”
Reviews.Author: Careles
Reviews.Content: The place was huge with an incredible view of the water. The pool was awesome with a wading area for young children. It was like a home away from home. We will definitely go again!!

Reviews.Title: “A geat value for 2 couples”
Reviews.Author: Wanderers48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value if you are traveling with another couple. We shared our suite with another couple, which was perfect because the suite contained a master bedroom with its own bathroom suite, and another bedroom also with a king size bed and another full bath. Two more couples in our party shared another suite. The screened balcony was very large and could easily accomodate 8-10 people.There is a large combination kithen/living room with a full compliment of appliances. For the price this is a very good value. You can watch the sun go down over the Gulf of Mexico from the dock, but there is an island that degrades the view a little. The beach is not really usable on the oceanfront. There is an adequate wading pool and main pool that is well maintained. The hotel was very quiet. There were two drawbacks: One was that the front desk clerks were not very personable and seemed inconvenienced whenever we asked a question, although they were civil. The other drawback is the hotel is very far away from Duval Street, so you have to have a car to enjoy the restaurants and other attractions on the South end of the island. The young lady (originally from Ukraine) that tends the Tiki bar makes up for the attitude of the front desk clerks. No matter who in our party of 8 (male or female) asked her for anything ranging from a fresh pool towel to a frozen drink, she left us smiling. In fact, once when we approached the Tiki bar she was wading in the ocean helping a little girl retrieve a toy. We all agree she should be recognized by Hyatt for her attitude and service. All 8 of us are talking about returning next year - I guess that is the ultimate rating!

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot; service is average.”
Reviews.Author: Prtravel1
Reviews.Content: We are Hyatt VC owners and we did not feel well treated during our stay. The staff was not that friendly and the did not seem to want to accommodate our requests. All in all, the rooms are big and comfy, but the people staff was only average. This is not what I expect as a Club owner.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hidden costs.”
Reviews.Author: debmtl
Reviews.Content: we were quoted a price with tax in, and upon check out we were told of additional costs 15:00 per day for internet connection, magazines, if we knew we were paying for the magazines we would have taken them with us. Problem with sugar ants, when we reported the problem to head desk, they responded with you must have left things on the counter?. Nice location, however no beach area, no shuttle service to downtown, no giveaways at this location. Rooms are large and suite is all equipped.

Reviews.Title: “A Piece of Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: plswinters
Reviews.Content: Key West is a great place. This resort is as far away from downtown as you can get on the island, about 4 miles. A car, bike, scooter or cab are pretty much necessary to get to town. The plus side is that it is the quietest part of the island. Supermarkets and fast food are within a mile+-. The pool area is beautiful and the rooms themselves are very nice. We spent most of our time on the screen porch that overlooks the pool and gulf. The channel on the east side of the property was full of wildlife including horseshoe crabs, nurse sharks, lots of fish and during our trip, 6 manatee. Be sure to rent a kayak to explore the mangroves.The tiki bar girl was very helpful with local info and reservations for attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and calm in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Gustoguy
Reviews.Content: This is a fine resort that is meticulously maintained. Painters worked every day to touch up and the pool and hot tub couldn't be better maintained. We were fortunate to have been given a 3rd floor room in building A (first one near the water, which has a great view of the bay and good sunset views)(if you have a Hyatt reward status card, flash that at sign-in as it seems to be a help). Try for an upper floor room for the water views. There is a small 'beach bar' where you can get beers, wine and weak mixed drinks (we were told it's because of the type of liquor license they have), so best to bring your own grog to the pool. There is a sandy area that leads to the 'beach' (a small patch leading to the bay). If you've never come to Key West (like us) you'll be surprised at how little real beach area there is on this island. So dont think "aruba" when you think KW beaches. They try to preserve whatever beach front they have by leaving the mangroves in place to prevent beach erosion. Therefore there are lots of plantings on this property; the pix on their web site are accurate representations. You'll spend your time in and by the pool. Rooms are clean and well maintained. Rooms are large with a huge master bath (we had a 2-bedroom and slept 5 including the pull-out sofa). Older TVs (DVDs are not blue ray) so come prepared with older DVDs. Free wireless internet has a great strong signal. Security is good, and as in any place, stash your stuff in the in-room safe (its big enough for 2 laptops plus handbags etc) and you wont be inviting problems. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Tuesdays are Margarita Party day with free drinks. Ample lounge chair supply (we were here during spring break and never had a problem getting 4 chairs together). No water sports at this location, so you'll need to contract with one of the many places closer to town for jet skis etc. which people used to get back here by water. Yes this is out of town, but there aren't too many really nice timeshares in town and believe me, after 3 days on Duval Street you'll be ready to escape the craziness. It takes about 10 minutes to drive to town with no traffic. Parking is ample at this resort but not in town. So when you drive to town just cruise up and down Southard or Fleming Streets (around Elizabeth) looking for parking spaces open to all (some are for residents only). You'll park 5 or 6 blocks off of Duval but you won't pay anything and it's a 5-10 minute walk to Duval or the Front street area. Since the resort is on Rt 1. it's simple to go north to Marathon (about 45 minutes) and other keys for a visit. Downsides to this place is that it doesn't have a 'convenience shop' where you can buy crisis items like milk or PAM. But the Publix and Albertsons are about a 3-5 minutes drive. There's no onsite restaurnat or snack bar and there is no onsite fitness center. If you want a morning paper be sure you get to the honor box before 8AM because the earlly risers snatch them up fast! All-in-all, a great place to hang out in KW.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and roomy!”
Reviews.Author: travelbybanana
Reviews.Content: The only thing I would change is the location. Even though it is on the main road, across the bridge and an immediate right as you enter Key West, it would have been nice to stay downtown or closer. It is very hard to find parking downtown so I suggest taking an alternate mode of transportation. We stayed in a two bedroom suite with 5 people and had tons of room. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The living space was huge and all the rooms have a screened in porch overlooking the pool area which adds extra living space. The pool and surrounding area was extremly appealing, clean and fun. There was a huge sandy area with lounge chairs and attached sun covers too. The beach was very small and rocky. All in all a beautiful resort with comfy and roomy accomodations. I would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to enjoy a vacation”
Reviews.Author: tcheaven
Reviews.Content: Regardless of what anyone else has to say about this resort, we experienced nothing but friendliness, great service, wonderful location, spacious and romantic rooms and more than we actually expected. All in all, I was most taken in by the grounds and the location to the Gulf. Mornings were a real blessing. The screened in porch was such a relief to enjoy a cup of coffee and pastries or breakfast in the morning with the warm breezes, palm trees, views of both the pool and hot tub and the gulf with the sounds of the local birds in the distance. The condo was very spacious and the master bedroom featured double sinks, a walk in glass shower and jacuzee bath with full length mirror for those romantic evenings. Many posted that the "beach" was nothing to mention, however, I found it relaxing with the chairs that they had on location and would have spent more time there reading or just talking on the phone, but we spent most evenings in the old town district and had a great time experiencing the local restaurants and "interesting" people. The sunset at Mallory Square is beautiful and exciting, but make sure you are there at the exact time of it's setting or you will miss all the fun and the performers. We would have liked to have spent more time at the Hyatt, but Venus beach was beckoning us with it's prehistoric shark's teeth. We shared the condo with another couple and they had a great time also.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Parks27909
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough good things about this place!! It has it all...two bedrooms, two bathrooms, kitchen, living room with sleeper sofa, most wonderful screened in porch, great pool, gas grills on the beach, hammocks, lounge chairs, pier (which our children were able to fish from), even saw a manatee swim right under the pier! Our kids are 12, 10, and 8 and this place could not have been more perfect. The location was not downtown but they make it so easy to go or do anything you want to do, you never even give it a thought. We were able to walk across the bridge and eat at the Hurrican Hole restaurant which was very good AND get bait and tackle for the kids to fish!! Oxy, the bartender at the tiki bar was the BEST and so helpful with all the activities/excursions we wanted to do. Not to mention--GREAT with the kids!! We can't wait to go back and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Leave Valuables in Room!!!”
Reviews.Author: snomison
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and there is beach outside the door but not the kind you can lounge on. Weather was miserable and there were no heaters in the rooms. We had items stolen by the maids and although they did an investigation and told us we would be reimbursed for the items, they did not send the check as they promised. No one there now knows anything about it even though the Corporate offices phoned to get the address and mail a check to us several weeks ago. They were not very efficient at the front desk and had poor customer service ! ! Would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities, service and staff”
Reviews.Author: BobColumbia_SC
Reviews.Content: Wonderful facilities and grounds. Staff is responsive to every immediately. We had a dishwasher go out, they replaced the unit while we were out as soon as we called. When we reported damage to a chair on the screened porch overlooking the water, they brought a replacement within 5 minutes. Kitchen is all you need to cook a full meal. Best value on KEY WEST

Reviews.Title: “A Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: DeniseMarie51
Reviews.Content: I have been to Key West many times, but this trip was the first time staying at the Hyatt Beach Resort. What a fabulous facility! Our unit was beautifully appointed and had the added bonus of a large screened in porch for morning coffee. Just about everything you could possibly need was provided in the unit from beach towels to all cooking needs (if you feel inspired to cook) to shampoo. The beds were the heavenly. The pool area featured a man-made beach with padded lounge chairs. The grounds were beautifully landscaped and extremely well maintained. Every member of the Hyatt staff that we interacted with was friendly, efficient, informative and customer service oriented. The only drawback is there is no restaurant, however there is a nice bar/restaurant and tiki bar at the facility next door and its a short walk across the parking lot. Looking forward to a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach Club, on the water, $10 cab ride to Duval”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Life7979
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this Hyatt to anyone--it has a beautiful white sand beach, pool, is on the water, and is only a $10 cab ride to downtown Duval. The rooms are beautiful, we stayed in a 2/2--the master bedroom had 2 large sinks, a roman tub and shower, and the couch pulls out. It was only $250/night because we stopped at one of those tourist information centers and the woman there booked us. Just make sure to feed the stray cats there, and although shy, they're sweet!

Reviews.Title: “False advertisement!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunfun10_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice inside and had a wonderul screened in porch and worked out well with our group because it slept 6 comfortably with 2 bathrooms. However we would not recommend this hotel becuase we were mislead on what was on the property. according to the wesite there was an array of water activities including a beach on property site. when we arrived there were none of these things and it was the furthest hotel from downtown key west. The staff at the hotel even agreed with us that they were false advertising what was at the property. all of these things was at a different hyatt location. Very nice hotel but please be aware if you want these things and be close to downtown seeing as the parking is around $10 everytime you go down there dont stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Again, a great place for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: hotelek
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Hyatt Beach House Resort and it is simply the best family resort in Key West. Everyone at the Front Desk was great, Housekeeping is always in the lookout to make your stay extremely comfortable and maintenance is always working hard to keep this property in excellent shape. Thank you all again for a great vacation and we will definitely go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: alohalittleann
Reviews.Content: Just got home from Key West with my family. I can't say enough positive things about the Hyatt Beach House Resort. Everyone was very friendly as soon as we walked in the door. We were able to check in early, thankfully, since we'd been traveling for such a long time. The condo was large enough for my husband & I, and our 3 kids ( ages 4, 10, & 13 ). The kitchen area was well stocked ( a grocery store just down the street ). The rooms were clean. Housekeeping was quick to bring us any extras we required. The BBQ area was great for preparing the main course for dinners. Having a washer/dryer in the room was perfect! We liked the location as well. We are just far enough from Duval St. and the downtown so that we had peace and quiet. However, we were only a short drive from all of the attractions Key West has to offer. A lot of people complain about the "beach area" not really being a beach. If you ask me, it's just right when you have young children to tend to. There's plenty of sand for making castles, & you don't have to worry about the possible hazards of having young children at the ocean. Best of all, the pool is perfect for kids of all ages. I was able to sit in the water, comfortably, with my 4 year old while she splashed around. Both of us felt very safe with this set up. My older kids were in the "deep" end and I was close enough to keep an eye on them as well. (They have beach towels available too. Less to pack! ) My only wish is that the vacation lasted longer! Key West is by far the best place to just sit back an RELAX and Hyatt Beach House Resort is the perfect place to hang you hat while in the Keys!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay but bored on the island.”
Reviews.Author: BeachLovers07
Reviews.Content: Went to the Hyatt Beach House Resort in Key West May 2010. We rented a convertible in Miami, drove through the keys, which was fun, and arrived at the resort. It's a great place to stay if you are looking for peace and quiet and not much to do. It's a low-key relaxing resort that's super small and doesn't offer much to do. If that's what you are looking for, than this is the place for you. There's nothing to criticize really about the resort, other than the small tv's and furniture in the rooms (very used). There was also no swim bar or restaurant on site. Each room offers a screened deck, which is GREAT. We used this every night/morning. We also enjoyed the huge jacuzzi tubs in the master bedroom and grilled a lot of fresh fish/peelneat shrimp from the local store. As far as Key West is concerned, we weren't that impressed. The nice part about the island is no matter where you stay, everything is convenient due to the size of the island. However, I would stay close to Duval St. if I had the choice just due to the fact that this is the only thing to really do on the island. Duval St. offers nice shopping and great restaurants. But the beaches/water were a huge disappointment and there's seriously nothing to do here unless you like to fish, which there are a ton of charter's to do so. I wouldn't pay the $200 to snorkel here either. One of the locals who ran a snorkel charter said if you've snorkeled the Virgin Islands, this would be a waste of money, which we have. If you have traveled to several beaches all over the Caribbean, you'd be disappointed coming here. Save your money and hit the Virgin Islands...WAY better, nicer, more to do, greater scenery, and the beaches are amazing, as is the sailing, snorkeling, etc. Key West doesn't offer much. Wouldn't go back unless all I want to do is sit around or drink all week. I was reading from other reviews that this place is "tropical." They haven't traveled much.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back again tomorrow if I could!”
Reviews.Author: christinetravels
Reviews.Content: I am a time share owner with the Hyatt Vacation Club in Breckenridge,CO Stayed at the Hyatt Beach Resort during the first week of May 2010. I loved the location..very peaceful environment, huge pool, a cute modest sandy beach, and just minutes drive from so much that Key West has to offer... Most time share resorts affiliated with hotels such as Hyatt, Marriott, and Starwood, etc are similar in that they are not at all considered hotels....Rather, they are more like upscale condos with updated furnishings and decorations inside and out compared to condos not owned by hotel vacation clubs...the difference is to be prepared when staying here....and anyplace similar...you need a car, a trip to the grocery store, and some patience..and then you can sit back, relax, and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: verypikytraveler123
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome, from check in to check out all the staff members were friendly. When we checked in we were given building E on the first floor. The room was HUGE, when you first walked in there was a bathroom and a room with a king bed and a TV. Then there was a kitchen with EVERYTHING in it .The family room had a pull out couch and a TV. There was a screened in porch with a table and a couch overlooking the pool. The master king bed room was huge. There was a TV a Jacuzzi tub, huge shower and a separate room for the toilet. The room was nicely decorated. We loved the pool and the hot tub it was very clean and even provided free toys. The king room rite when you walk in was very noisy. In the morning you could hear people walking up and down the stairs and there flip flops banging on the wood. The other bad thing about this hotel is when we checked out the there was a 49 DOLLAR CHARGE for 7 local calls at 7 dollars each. On the phone it said free local calls and free 800 calls. They said they were having "trouble with there phone company", so remember to CHECK OUT. Other than that everything was great. I will return to this hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 place”
Reviews.Author: viraldalal
Reviews.Content: Excellent place and most beautiful place to stay in keywest !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FOR FAMILIES”
Reviews.Author: larissaleonkey
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Key West and had to get on here to say that this hotel is great for families with young kids! The pool was a zero entry pool and the kids just loved playing at the shallow end. In addition there was a sand area with a toy box full of sand toys for the kids to play with. Very kids friendly! We spent two full days just lounging at the pool. The hotel is about 4 miles from the main area of Key West, Duval ST. but the travel was worth it because once we were done exploring with our little ones we could relax at the hotel. Our room was a two room and the floor plan was very open and inviting for us. In addition we always had the back door to the deck open because of the screened in porch, our daily dinners were eaten on the deck . I Loved this place it truly allowed us to have a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Pictures don't describe accomodations”
Reviews.Author: knowitall_10
Reviews.Content: The uint was well appointed, all the amenties a family needs including a screened porch with table. The resort describes their "private beach", but it is not really a beach just sand around the pool and harbor. The beach is approximately 30 yards long, and not amenable to swimming. The hotel is a distance from town, and a 3 mile walk to a sandy beach. Be sure you rent a car if you choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: dbqgirl
Reviews.Content: You are 4 miles from Front St. So need car to get back and forth. Rooms big, pull-out bed best for kids only. Screened in porch is where we spent most waking hours. Tables inside and on porch can hold 6 people. TVs small but in each bedroom along with living area. Pool shallow, but nice to sit by. Very small beach, but people fishing from dock were catching fish. Elevator and carts available to haul suitcases, but not easy to find. Beach towels in room were nice to use at pool. Washer and dryer in room great also, even provide you with two small boxes of Tide. We didn't have any issues with the free wifi. Could faintly hear dogs barking at nearby SPCA, a few mornings on our porch, but never a real bother. A few roosters around, which could wake you if you were a light sleeper and your window is open. We were in building F which allowed our porch to be in the shade all day.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: nneckles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with 4 friends, stayed at the Hyatt Beach Club Hotel in October 2009. The hotel was very nice. The website does not do the property justice. The place was well maintained, quiet, aesthetically pleasing and the staff was very helpful. The pool is pretty but shallow; the deepest point is about 4ft, so that was a little disappointing for us. The internet connection was very poor. They are a little misleading about the fact that there is not restaurant on the property. On their website and in the room directory, they advertise two restaurants. However, these restaurants are not on-site, they are at the Hyatt Resort, about 10 minutes away. It was not a major problem for us because there are many other local restaurants to sample, but it was misleading all the same. They are very strict about checking out on time, they would not allow us a late check out. Other than those minor things, we were all very pleased with the place. It slept 6 adults quite comfortably. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Ask for More!”
Reviews.Author: lcr2654
Reviews.Content: I almost hate to tell anyone about this place since it was so great and I want to go back again! The room/suite was immaculate, quiet and beautiful. Had everything any one could want. Beautiful pool area, screened porchs on each unit. great staff. The only drawback was having to pay extra for a second parking space- in was a two room suite. and that it was a ways from downtown. It was perfect for us 50 somethings who want a quiet place and like to make our own dinner at home.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: RayRayUNC
Reviews.Content: I've owned a timeshare here for 5 years and I finally got a chance to stay here. Let me say it was money well spent. This place is a beautiful and relaxing place. We really enjoyed this. There are only a few things some may have problems with. One, it is not walking distance to downtown and they have no shuttle. Secondly, there is no fitness center there but you use a sister Hyatt for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you know what you're getting”
Reviews.Author: jmax291
Reviews.Content: It's a bit misleading that this hotel is called a Hyatt, but if you understand the Hyatt Vacation Club concept, then it's perfect. The rooms are large 2-bedroom condos with upscale amenities and all of the comforts of home. Each one has a great furnished porch overlooking the pool. Guests should know that the only employees/services they'll see here are at check-in, around the pool, and the maids who come to change towels. Housekeeping will clean your room for a fee. Also, there is no workout center, but they let you use the downtown Key West Hyatt for free, which is a 20 minute car ride away, but is limited itself in size and scope.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for families in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: hotelek
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the day of our departure we had nothing but fun. The rooms are great with everything you can imagine to make your vacation quite comfortable. The common areas around the property are great and cleaned every morning. Donâ€™t miss the gas barbecues in the beach area, THEY ARE GREAT. The pool is a little small, but other than that is great. At last what makes this property great is the staff, from the front desk (Ms. Jacki B., Ms. Yvonne, Ms. Claudette & Ms. Cheryl) they always have a smile and try to accommodate every demand to the housekeeping who work very hard to keep the rooms and other areas clean, Thank you all for everything. We are definitely coming back next year

Reviews.Title: “It's like being in Paradise ..."”
Reviews.Author: wcfBucksCo_Pa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Beach House on an Interval exchange. Check-in went smoothly on Sunday 7-12-09. We arrived before 12 Noon, and our room was ready so we lucked out and started our vacation immediately. The ladies at the desk were very personable and cordial. Accommodations: roomy, two bedroom, two bath, jacuzzi in master bathroom, plenty of towels, even a pull out sofa. Screened in porch which faces the pool. Modern appliances, very clean. Outside gardens were beautiful, lush vegetation. Pool is small and only 4' deep without any shade, lots of beach chairs around the pool and at the beach. Two grills are on site at the back of the property. Located 4 miles from Zero Duval Street and all its "allure". Three supermarkets right on Rt 1. Lobby has a computer and printer for guests' use. They have a lending library with books, games and puzzles. Also a video rental box. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not activity friendly”
Reviews.Author: cammi03
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip to combine leisure with some sight-seeing. Having two teenage boys along we were hoping for some activities at the resort. The beach which was advertised seemed like it would be a great place for them to practice their soccer skills. I was disappointed. The beach is more for little kids. There are chaise lounges on most of it, along with the grills. The pool is only 4.5 feet deep. There was a building which may have served once as a little activity station but it was all locked up. (Maybe used once for refreshments?) Our friends stayed at the Hyatt Windward Pointe. Much more teen friendly. They have beach volleyball, pool tables, ping pong, shuffleboard, a larger, deeper pool and activities for the family. A beautiful view of the ocean! There is not a great view of the ocean from the Beach House. It is set back in off of the main road and off of a channel. I definitely would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location for trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaLongfamily
Reviews.Content: This time-share rental was perfect for our family's adventure to Key West, Fl. We went based on the recommendation of good friends, and were not disappointed in the least. The staff was impecible, the accommodations were just as expected, and the resort was beautiful and exactly what we wanted and needed for a family with 10 and 12 year old daughters. This property has a beautiful lagoon pool with zero entry, a private sandy area with cabana-style seating, and a dock overlooking the Gulf of Mexico. Being on the northwest side of the island, immediately after crossing the bridge into Key West, it is a perfect distance from the fun nightlife on Duval, but not far at all... some couples even bicycled daily to the Old Town area. (the island is only 4 miles long to begin with!) Each Monday, the conceirge holds a breakfast by the pool complete with directors from manyh of the local entertainment venues - this is a great opportunity to attend a short meeting and rack up on some great discounts on things that you will want to do during the week, such as Lloyd's Famous Bicycle Tour and MANY water sport adventures. The only thing that the Hyatt does not have is a restaurant or bar on location, but you do have a full kitchen in your rental, plus many, many amazing restaurants in Old Town and near the water. We will be back.... things could not have been more perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: UGADawg83
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful week at the Hyatt Beach House-Key West. Yes, its a few miles into Old Town Key West but its kind of nice to get out of the noise, hustle and bustle of Duval Street. The accomodations are certainly spacious and first rate. The small beach area is sort of contrived but then there really is no true "beach" at Key West. The water is crystal clear and there is a nice dock. The condo property could use a few more amenities like a pool bar, and an on sight restaraunt but it certainly offers quality acommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: marksam1
Reviews.Content: Beautifully landscaped, large rooms, best king sized bed I've slept in, screened in porch, whirlpool bath in bedrooms, full kitchen, swimming pool geared to children & non-swimmers, hot tub, gas grills for barbecuing, books & games in office, sandy beach with an abundance of chairs for sunbathing, small beach for snorkeling, a dock for fishing & pleasant helpful employees. This resort is on the opposite side of the key from noise of Mallory square & Duvall St. with access to the restaurant, beach & exercise facilities of the other Hyatt's on Key West. This is a perfect place for families with children but probably too far from the action if you want to get drunk & pick up people on Duvall St. 2-3 minutes by car from the other side of the island where parking can be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation with young kids.”
Reviews.Author: lori0678
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the beach house in April 2009. This property is immaculate, with amazing 2 bedroom suites with great sun porches. The pool is awesome for young kids with a zero degree entry and a beach area right next to the pool. The layout of the property made for a very stress free vaction with a 1 and 4 year old. The location is a 15minute drive to the downtown area, but, we didn't mind as we had our car. We found parking easily on highway #1 or whitehead street and also on Duval for only a few dollars. There are tons of attractions for kids in Key west we did the Pirate museum, the aquarium and the sunset festival. The kids had a great time and so did we! There isn't a real beach at the hotel, but there aren't any nice beaches in Key west. The Keys aren't the place to go, if you want big white sand beaches, go to an island in the caribbean for that. All in all a fun vacation in a beautiful tropical island that you can drive to. This resort is a quiet family resort not a party resort with lost of young people. I would recomend for all families or couples looking a for a quiet relaxed vacation. Oh and if you go to Key west go to Blue Heaven on Thomas St. for a meal, the most amazing atmosphere, food, drinks and the Key lime pie is to die for......the kids loved this place and so did we!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, but worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelDelaware
Reviews.Content: This is a middle of the road place to stay, but the rooms and grounds were excellent. The location was off the beaten path and as much as they try to portray it as connected to the fabric of Key West, the reality is that you will probably drive to everything. That being said, the rooms were meticulously cleaned, furnishings up to date and the grounds very nice. There is no beach (so I'm not sure about the name they gave it) to hang out on. There is a sand area near the pool. We used the gas grills quite often. A nice touch. We brought our kids, but would not do that again. Not really a good town for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Pool Area!”
Reviews.Author: beachtraveler074
Reviews.Content: This was a nice setting, away from the noise of Highway 1. It is tucked nicely away from everything else in Key West yet only a five minute drive to downtown Key West. Very nice zero depth pool, with plent of lounge chairs and very clean pool area. Hot tub was nice too. There is a small beach which is a little rocky but that didn't stop me from going in to snorkel because the water is so clear in this spot that you can see 10 - 12 feet to the bottom. You won't see the nice bright coral reef fish, but you will see several varieties of fish, crabs and horseshoe crabs. If you want a sandy beach, I recommend either Smathers Beach or Higgs Beach, both on the Atlantic side of the island (about a 3 mile drive). Accomodations were very comfortable with the nicest screened in porch I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet resort”
Reviews.Author: its_just_ice
Reviews.Content: Stayed during 'off' season and got a very good price. Nice, spacious room. Beautifully landscaped. Very comfortable and well appointed rooms. Quiet area, but near stores. This is good, since you have a full kitchen if you want to eat in sometimes or use the onsite grills for cookouts. Charcoal, etc. available from front office. Need to pay to park downtown, or take a cab, as it is about 3.5 miles to downtown area. Bikes would be good. Many people rent mopeds, also. Pool is shallow and would be good for small kids. It is an odd pool and goes from 0 to 4 feet, but only in a 3 foot section, then goes back down to about 3.5 feet. Beach area is not good for swimming, but for sunbathing and looks. There is a lot of vegetation and a sign warns of strong current. There is a small dock at the water and you can probably fish. You can take advantage of the amenties at the other Hyatt resort, but another review said you had to pay to park there. We did not go there.

Reviews.Title: “A nice laid back place”
Reviews.Author: cocoWestPalmBeach_Fl
Reviews.Content: We did an exchange to the Beach House from our resort in Hawaii. We read mixed reviews. Overall it is a very clean comfortable resort. Not much in amenities but there is a lovely pool and jacuzzi. The beach is just for lounging. You can't go in the water because of the lack of access.. The concierge Ron was very helpful. There is a fee for the shuttle to Old town. So you pay it or go in on your own and pay for parking. I would return there one day. Pam K

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Lacking at the Beach House”
Reviews.Author: CrystalBeachMom
Reviews.Content: First I do need to state that I am an owner at the Hyatt Beach House Resort. In other words I own a time share there. This is the first time since buying our unit 4 years ago that we actually stayed there. Usually we trade to go to other places and have always been very pleased. The room at the Beach House, though older, is very nice. Not as nice as some of the other Hyatts, say the Windward Point, or Aspen, but it is clean and quite comfortable. The furnishings and beds were very nice and comfortable. All the amenities you need are there. We asked for and got a high chair and later found out if we even wanted an ice tea maker we could get one of those too. But, the NOISE. We have a second floor unit. Every time the sliding door to the patio above or below was opened you heard it. When the pocket door on the bathroom was closed, and the light/ fan turned on, you hear it. When the guy upstairs uses the bathroom you hear it. When the jacuzzi tub is turned on, you hear it. And because, the units are so close together, when your neighbor has a party till 2 in the morning....... ............ And I do have ot admit tht I am a bit disappointed with the view. when we bought our unit 4 years ago because it had a perfect view of the sunset, now it's obscured by some of the trees that have grown up. The trees need to be kept trimmed. Other than that it's a nice room. The property itself is a bit lacking as well. You can tell that because the Windward Point is the sales center that's where the money goes. Lots of shady chairs with umbrellas, a pergola with shade cloth, a very nice snack bar, and music all at the pool. At the Beach House shade is lacking. More umbrellas are needed. Not all of us are sun lovers but we do like to sit by the pool. And a pergola over the sand where the kids like to play. It was so hot my grandson cried when he stepped on the hot sand. No music at the Beach House and the chickie hut seemed to be an after thought. I'd also think twice before purchasing the shuttle pass. We paid for a full week, $125. In hindsight, we would have spent less than that on parking and had the convenience of having our car right there, and not running to catch the van.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: acars12
Reviews.Content: A nice clean timeshare resort. It lacks a bar or restaurant on site and the pool is only 4 foot. But overall it's a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great family getaway!”
Reviews.Author: scoothhi
Reviews.Content: My wife and our two kids, 11 & 7, stayed at the Hyatt Beach House as an Interval International exchange for a summer family vacation. We have stayed at several hotel and timeshare resorts over the years. This was one of the best. We were pleasantly surprised by a call from the concierge several days prior to our arrival to check and see if we had any questions and/or needs that could be addressed prior to our stay. The quality and cleanliness of the resort and our room were excellent. The staff was always friendly and attentive to our requests. The setting was nice and secluded away from heavy tourist activity. However, we felt like everything we needed was relatively close. Our kids loved staying there and we would gladly go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accommodatoins”
Reviews.Author: simtraveler
Reviews.Content: Really nice accommodations. Well landscaped and groomed. Note that you really don't want to go into the water at the hotel - it's more for boats. And the pool has a walk-in entry which is nice but it gets no deeper than 3 feet - too shallow to really swim much. Zachary Taylor state park has a very nice beach in Key West but expensive to rent chairs ($10 each).

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Name "HYATT"”
Reviews.Author: FEDEFOL
Reviews.Content: I ll go straight to the point. the HYATT BEACH HOUSE RESORT has nice rooms, a kids pool (def not for adults) and a fake beach(sun until 4); other than that no sport activity is available on site, not even beach volley or table tennis, not to mention a GYM that is obviously NOT available in the resort. I asked for one and they suggested to go to the other Hyatt on the other side of the island, where the gym would be free, the only issue was the $12 to park the car IN THE RESORT!!! In case you re looking for a supermarket , a bar or a restaurant, the closest is 2 miles from the resort. Another complain,Internet is a RIP OFF, I paid $30 for 4 days and the server went down every 20 mins. I called the "I-Hotel" internet provider at least 10 times over the 4 days and they kept saying the issue was on the Hotel side, not on their side. The guys at the hotel had no idea what i was talking about but said they would speak with the "internet guy". Few hours after Internet worked. Each time I had to call and report the issue, I didnt complain too much but on the 4th day I asked to have extra time to make up for the time I paid and could not use, they said they could not do that. I spoke with another customer in the hotel and he said he had the same issue. Think twice before you consider to pay for internet here. Overall, if you go with timeshare, have kids and just want to relax this place might be a good solution.. You can find better places than this for the bucks...easily..

Reviews.Title: “I would have been better off burying my money in a hole”
Reviews.Author: Zulu61
Reviews.Content: It used to be a really nice place, many years ago. We bought a two bedroom unit (sleeps six) when it was still being developed around ten years ago and purchased the Premium week of Christmas. We had three kids and vacations can get pretty pricey so it seemed like a great idea. We looked forward to our trip for about the first five years. After that we have actually forfeited our week and have let the points expire (there goes about a grand) because it is such a hassle to go through the machinations of rescheduling anything that makes sense. The hoops you have to jump through to reschedule any week but your own and the Resorts International nightmare maze is just not to be believed. After the initial purchase costs were finally paid (somewhere in the neighborhood of 20k and that took till my kids all grew up), the yearly maintenance fee has grown to become ridiculous (approx. $1000.00). Yet the rooms are worn, the appliances and furniture are only replaced if something is unusable and it doesn't look like there will be modern upgrades to be incorporated any time soon. As an insulting addition they offer wireless Internet as a "convenience" to the guests, however they don't bother to mention the exorbitant rate they CHARGE (something like an additional $10 dollars a day per computer) anyplace on their website and only post it in the signage where you can connect. However, the Mc Donald's in Key West offers it for free, so figure that one out. Consequently, the place is really showing its age (where is the maintenance fee going??) and in dire need of repair along with some major improvements. I would have been better off burying my money in a hole. I honestly must say it was the most naive financial decision I have ever made and I must have been overcome by the sunshine fumes and the margaritas that year. Good luck trying to sell this "Lifetime Deedable Investment" and get even half of your money back. Never again, never. Do I still stay there? Yes, on occasion since we have family in Florida (though we live up North now) but honestly we try to avoid it whenever possible and hope the stars align so that we can go someplace else in the network. We have only managed to accomplish that four times in all these years though so I have learned to not hold my breath.

Reviews.Title: “Management needs help”
Reviews.Author: LincolnLog
Reviews.Content: Management is non-existent and the conceige is pathetic. On the plus side the grounds are well kept and the resort is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great week in Key West - Hyatt Beach House Resort”
Reviews.Author: FamilyRI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Beach House Resort from 6/23 - 6/30/07. It is a great place to stay if you want a "home away from home"--two bedrooms, two baths, kitchen, dining area, living room, nice screened porch with wicker furniture (glass table and four chairs for dining, wicker couch and table and rocking chair). The kitchen was well stocked with dishes, glassware, silverware, pots, pans, towels, pot holders, paper towel, dish soap, dishwasher detergent...the list goes on. Very comfortable dining area and living room spaces. The second bedroom was great for our 16 year old daughter--gave her space with a TV, which she loved. My 13 year old son slept on the queen sleeper sofa, with his own TV in the living room area. We had the huge master bed/bathroom, which had a great glassed in shower, double sinks, jacuzzi tub, separate toilet area, good closet. Drawer space in each bedroom was not an issue with a built-in set of four drawers per room. Each room also has an apartment-sized washer/dryer combo, which was a great convenience--it was nice to go home with clean clothes, even supplied with two individual-wash sized containers of Tide! The pool is shallow (not more than 4 feet deep) but very nice for families with small children, which a nice sandy area with sand toys for the kids to play in, plenty of comfortable beach chairs and cabana-style double chaises with pads. There are picnic tables with grills available to grill food (the front desk is helpful to provide grilling tools, charcoal, lighter fluid and matches in a shed where the grills are). Don't go to Key West expecting gorgeous, sand beaches because that is not what the Keys are about. Higgs, Smathers and the other beaches along the southern side of the island are sandy and nice with very calm, warm water--parking can be expensive. We went to Fort Zachary Taylor State Park, where there is a nice beach with breakwaters that are great for snorkeling--has a nice snack bar with chair, umbrella and other types of rentals, plus plenty of shaded picnic tables--nice place to spend a day for less than $10 per car with 4 people. The waterfront area is a "waterfront area" not especially a beach but a great place to sit on the dock and watch the sunset. Although it is sandy and there is a nice dock to fish from with water equipment rentals, there is a big sign warning people about the current in front of the property. The property sits on the corner of the Gulf and a channel that has a strong current and not a safe place to swim or snorkel--nice for kayaking, jet skis, etc. The concierge in the front lobby was very helpful in booking trips and activities and with moped rentals--definitely a great, less expensive way of getting around when parking is $10-12 per day down by Duval Street. Our kids loved skooting around the island on the mopeds for the week--we just parked our car in the parking provided under the buildings that was free and shaded at the hotel.
