I know there have been notes about the cleanliness of this hotel however, we found it clean with the exception of the tile floor-it was not 100% clean but tile floors with heavy traffic will get dirty, even if they are clean and maintained. Overall, we would stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it to couples or families that are looking for a condo-type atmosphere, in a quieter area that is very comfortable and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise for a week”
Reviews.Author: margaritagirlToronto
Reviews.Content: We had a girlfriends gettaway in Key West for a week. Time away from the cold and rain and sometimes snow of Toronto where we live. Stayed at the Hyatt Beach House Resort for the first time. It is in an excellent location for a quiet relaxing and enjoyable stay. Away from the hustle and bustle of Duval St. but close enough to get to the action when you want it. We had a double suite - very spacious and luxurious and decor is inviting. Outside verandah is a wonderful touch - breakfast on the patio in the early morning sun, listening to the birds and gentle rustle of the palms as they sway in the tropical breeze. Beautiful. Pool is shallow, but very enjoyable, hot tub great for meeting new friends. Tiki bar on the grounds is run by outside staff and closed up shop too early - 5 pm each day exc.Wed. closed at 4. The resort is beautifully landscaped and well taken care of. But, the floors in the suites and the refridgerator could have used a little more care in cleaning....feet were filthy 10 mins. after you showered and the fridge was dingy on the inside. Daily maid service is available at $50.00 more per day. We were on tight budget and did it ourselves. Linen change for everyone on Wednesdays. The resort is a great place for families with young children. The shallow pool is good for them. Teenagers it would be too boring. There should be more entertainment poolside provided....one afternoon for an hour we had a local steelband performer we enjoyed very much. But it was over too soon. Key West was a lot of fun - many things to do - we didn't get it all in. We took the ferry trip to the Dry Tortugas. Interesting place, but not a whole days worth. Yankee Freedom 2 charged too much I think. $129.00 US for what I feel $70.00 was more appropriate. Spring migration was underway so there were a lot of photo ops for birdwatchers and butterfly lovers alike. Snorkelling offshore we didn't see very much coral life. All in all, we loved Key West, want to go again and again. Great weather. Packing tip: Pack everything you think you'll need and then take half of it out !!!! Very casual dress in this location no need for the fancy shoes and dresses!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: vjmoore
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights, 2/18 - 2/22. Room was very nice. Pool area was never crowded and have plenty of lounge chairs, many with covers. Only problem was on the first night, the very very very loud fire alarm in the hotel being built next door went off at 2am and was not turned off until 5:30am. Even a call to the local police did nothing to help the situation, it seems it happens often enough that they know there is no fire so no one bothers to send anyone to shut it off. As other reviews stated the construction did start every morning next door at 7am. It wasn't a problem in the master bedroom but the second bedroom was loud when it started. No restaurant on site but the rooms have a full kitchen and there are grocery stores just down the street. If you like sailing/snorkling/kayaking check out Danger Charters. Great trip with a great crew.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as Marriott Timeshares”
Reviews.Author: mrmet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I own a Marriott timeshare and traded our 2007 week through Interval International. We were VERY excited when we landed the Hyatt Beach House Resort and we're looking forward to the "Hyatt Experience". I expected the Hyatt to be a bit nicer than other Marriott timeshare properties we had stayed at.....Not so. First, the resort is located as far away as you can possibly get from Old Town Key West, while still being on the island. It's about 3.5 miles away, and is located off U.S. 1. There are lots of strip mall shopping centers nearby and lots of places to buy necessities, pizza and chain-type restaurants. It would be helpful if the Hyatt operated a shuttle to the Old Town area, but inexplicably they do not. It would save $5-$15 in daily parking fees among other things. When we checked in, we noticed that there is a MAJOR construction project going on next store, unrelated to the Hyatt property. Since our unit was on that side and we have a 1 and 3 year old, I asked to be relocated to a unit away from the construction. The receptionist said this wouldn't be possible since we booked through Interval International and the rooms for I.I. are allocated near the construction. Nice service! So after further conversation, the receptionist consulted with her manager. He/she denied our request to be moved. (note that after 3 days staying here, it appears the property is only 40% occupied!) It's impossible for me to believe that relocating us would have been any issue, despite the fact that I am Hyatt Gold. That's the "Hyatt Experience". The units are not that great. We booked a 2 Bedroom. The main living area is very narrrow and has a kitchen area built along one wall. The floor is tile and was very dirty as evidenced by the color of our children's feet after a few minutes of play. There is a bedroom and bath at the front of the unit and a master bedroom with bath at the rear. The Master Bedroom has a shower and hot tub en suite, and a W.C. It's pretty nice. Each unit includes a large screened-in porch which is really nice as well. It has a table with 4 chairs, rattan couch and rocking chair. The disappointing thing about the unit is how small and narrow the main living area is. I've seen New York City apartments with more space. We had problems with the toilets in both bathrooms which I fixed. We also had the water shut off for about 1 hour one morning when we wanted to shower. Apparently the construction next store caused a problem with one of the water mains and the City had to temporarily shut the supply off. The pool is absolutely beautiful and varies in depth from 0' to 4'. It's ideal for young kids. There is also a hot tub. The exterior of the resort is pretty, well landscaped and nicely maintained. Despite the 'brochure pictures' you may have seen, THERE IS NO BEACH. Based on the resort pictures we looked at before booking the trip, this is seriously misleading, bordering on false advertising. Sure enough, the construction kicked in at 7am every morning and lasted through 5pm every afternoon. The banging sounds weren't that terrible, more isolated to when our kids normally take their afternoon nap, go figure. Well I take that back. I am listening to a jack hammer as I type this. If you've stayed at Marriott timeshare resorts, they're a cut above the Hyatt Beach House resort. Maybe the other Hyatt timeshares in Old Town are nicer....trust me and skip the Hyatt Beach House resort!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: 6Hoopers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Beach House Resort in April of 2006 in a two bedroom. It was very nice for the price. The staff was friendly, the room was well decorated and clean, and the pool was nice, though crowded. The Hyatt wasn't overly crowed though, we never felt encroached upon at all and the atmosphere was pretty relaxed. The beach area was a joke though, plenty of sand, but only about twenty feet of it met the water and that was rocky. Our children ages 7,5, and 1&1/2, didn't spend much time there. Having said that, we would stay at the Hyatt Beach House again if we went back to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation with friends and family”
Reviews.Author: travelbug323
Reviews.Content: My friends and I vacationed at the Hyatt Beach house in November. We were very impressed with our impeccably clean, new, very large 2 bedroom unit. It had a very large screened in porch where we enjoyed breakfast with the beautiful view. It definitely exceeded our expectations. The only recommnedation I have is for the guests to ensure they have a rental car as Duval St is about 10 minutes away. You are close enough to the shopping.nightlife yet far enough to relax .

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but pool is for kids only”
Reviews.Author: NYWebTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hyatt Beach House, and were generally impressed with the size and cleanliness of the rooms. They were well maintained and decorated. The kitchen included all we needed for a comfortable stay that felt more like home than a hotel room. We stayed in the wing opposite the construction so it was generally quiet. The location is right in the entrance to the island, which made it pretty far from most points of interest. Other nice things included parking under the units, which is very appreciated with the heat that is generated down there. Main disappointment was the pool which was 4 feet deep at it deepest, and that was only a small section; most it was 3 feet or less. This is great for young kids but larger ones and adults need something deeper. Another annoyance was that you had to pay for wireless internet access ($10/day), which is pretty ridiculus for a $275/night room. Finally, no shuttle service is provided to downtown or the other Hyatts on the island, so a car is required and parking in Key West is a major hassle. They really should provide a shuttle to the Hyatt by Mallory Square. I don't want to give a bad impression of this place. Although a bit pricey, it is a nice place which we would consider again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you get the right room!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Hyatt BeachHouse. We were down there a few weeks ago, so knew about the construction next door and requested a room on the other side of the hotel. Also requested a room near my sister's family. The Hyatt accommodated us and we had a wonderful room in the A bldg. My sister was in the B bldg. We had a noisy group above us on the first night, but slept well every night after. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The beds very comfortable for a good night's sleep. Maid service was very pleasant and efficient. The front desk staff was very also very friendly and helpful. I have never had to pay a fee for late check out, but be aware.....if you can't get out of the room by 10AM, there is no calling for late check out (as we often do in other nice hotels) Here it will cost you $20 per additional hour. We just hustled a bit more. The grounds were very well kept, but did flood a bit when a good storm moved in this week. My sister's family was not as fortunate. They had a room under a group that makes a LOT of noise at 3 and 4 in the morning. (moving furniture, opening and closing sliding doors, banging cabinets.....) They did not get much sleep each night after3AM. Said it also sounded like kids running around over them at the wee hours of the morning. Front desk staff really had no suggestions on how to alleviate the problem though. I think a nice, friendly call from the desk to the offending room would have gone a long way. Overall, it was a great place to stay and we would not hesitate to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, but be aware there is new construction next door”
Reviews.Author: C57W
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Beach House Resort from June 17-19, 2006. This is the second time in two years we have chosen to stay at this resort. As was the case the last time we stayed in 6/04, we found the resort well kept, clean and everything in very good repair. It is a quiet, beautiful area and well away from the hustle/bustle of downtown Key West. We met my sister's family there who had flew down earlier in the week from Ohio to spend some time in Key West with them. We were assigned a unit along the water in Bldg. B while my sister was placed in Bldg. F. Unbenownst to us, there is a new condo complex being built on the Bldg. D,E,F side (it replaces an old hotel which had been torn down) and crews started work at 5:30 a.m.! Needless to say, they did not get much sleep, and she was not happy about this situation. Although they complained to the staff, nothing was done to try to accomodate them in another quieter unit, so they eneded up putting up with the noise. So if you plan to stay here over the next 6 months or so, you should be aware that this new condo complex is just in the shell stage and will be under construction for quite a while yet. You might want to request a unit in Bldg. A, B or C. We on the other hand, being on the 'quiet' side of the complex, thoroughly enjoyed our stay and certainly intend to visit this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a number of hotels/condos across the US and this was by far the best value. Clean, spacious accommodation, well-equipped although a full oven would have been better than the hob & combination microwave provided. Lovely pool, right on the coast. US 1 is very close but we did not notice it - the woodpecker attacking the plastic(?) guttering with confused enthusiasm caused more of a disturbance. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LorraineEdwards
Reviews.Content: I had read the very mixed reports. (mostly Good ) and decided "The Hyatt Beach Resort" was just the right choice for my family.... The condo's are huge and spotless clean, and the kitchen area has all that you could want... The staff were very friendly and polite, we even had the choice of 3 rooms to pick.. Housekeeping was only on a Wednesday BUT they change the towels daily.(there are more than enough towels to last at least 3 days anyway)..... In fact we decided that we didn't need the housekeeping on the Wednesday we were there. It was nice being out of the busy downtown area, and atleast you are getting more open space and a great pool. Wonderful place would go back again and again....

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine”
Reviews.Author: conch7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach House Dec. 11 thru the 18th. The rooms were very large and clean. The washer and dryer were great as we only packed for 3 days instead of 7. The staff were all friendly and helpful. There were always enough beach/poolside chairs available although some people try to reserve them even though you aren't supposed to. Although it is 4 miles to Duval Street it only took a few minutes in the rental car. We never had a problem parking downtown although sometimes we would have to search for a spot for a few minutes. Try to park in the municipal lot or one of the lots that charge $10 for all day parking. Nothing is very far away from any of the lots. We will definately stay here again as it is convenient and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Our visit was just okay”
Reviews.Author: kiwi6
Reviews.Content: We visited the Hyatt Beach House in September, my first impression on checking in was not the best. The gentleman on reception asked me to wait until he had finished speaking to one of the staff. He chatted and laughed with the staff member for what seemed to have been a very long 5 minutes. When we were eventually sent to our apartment the room was not made up, so back to reception we went and had to wait again until we were given another apartment. No complaints about the state of the apartment, it was very tidy and spacious. My only negative comments would be the carparking area is just stones - not easy to drag your suitcases along. You receive no Hyatt Reward Points - something to do with the apartments being individually owned I believe I was told. But most disappointing was the customer service, boy does that need some work.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta go BACK here!”
Reviews.Author: cherylrf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Beach House Resort from Oct 9th through the 16th, 2005. This is one of those places that we will return to! The rooms were very comfortable and clean and really looked exactly like the web site shows. This is a property that is out of the noise and comotion of the downtown area. Off the living room you have a screened in porch that is very comfy in the early AM for reading or just relaxing. A great place for families because the pool goes from one inch to four feet. The Tiki Hut has wonderful drinks. Everyone there is very friendly and accomodating. If you don't want to drive in to town, you can walk about 2 blocks through the park and pick up the Bone Island Shuttle to go into the downtown area. This is an all around great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great room!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room at this resort was very big and was nice to have so much room with 4 adults and 2 children. The room service was horrible! No service!! We had to go to housekeeping to get our towels almost every day. The fridge took a whole day to get cool enough to put our food in. We loved the room itself (very nice). Just prepare to not have any service. We also believe we had a ghost that we heard and picked up on our camera. Very Creepy, but pretty cool for key west. Had some problems but all in all enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Have proper expectations and you'll like it”
Reviews.Author: RobR
Reviews.Content: You need a few facts to temper your expectations in order to make a proper judgment about this place. First, it's not a hotel at all; it's a condominium complex. There's no restaurant, room service, etc. There's a front desk and concierge service. When trying to arrange some boat trips, the concierge was nowhere to be found, but the front desk was extremely helpful in making arrangements. Second, you're four miles from downtown (just over the bridge onto Key West), so you're going to be driving (and parking) a lot. Last, the pool is average, as is the beach (although most of the beaches in the keys are not worth writing home about). That being said, the room itself was very nice. Large, spacious and new. Great bathroom and whirlpool tub. Good kitchen for making light meals and storing cold food and drinks. It's a great place for a group of people/family to stay and spend some time in between enjoying Key West.

Reviews.Title: “great facility, indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: roller7301
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Hyatt Beach House. The actual unit was very nice and offered pretty views. But it was really not any more special than the many condos in the Key West area. The pool was tiny, crowded and the pool water was unbelievably hot. On day #2, the landscapers put down cow manure in the middle of the day around the pool landscaping. It stunk to high heaven! The general consensus with the guests in the pool was - quite a distance from downtown (good & bad) but rude, indifferent staff really should be fired. On Day #3, the cleaning crew left my room door open when they were done (we were out). Best if you just want the extra space for a family and don't mind lots of driving to get where you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Beach House!”
Reviews.Author: stoverny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our first stay at the Beach House. We were very impressed. The units are large 2-BR units, nicely furnished with full kitchens including a dishwasher, fridge/freezer, washer/dryer, and all needed silverware and pots/pans/etc. There are ceiling fans in the living room, each bedroom, and on the screened in deck (nice!). There are 2 bathrooms, including a lovely master bath with a jacuzzi and separate glass shower. Units are a very nice size for 4 adults, although I think more than that might feel a little cramped. Pool was great, nice size, beautifully landscaped, and in my opinion probably the nicest pool on Key West (at least of the ones I've seen, including the other 3 Hyatts on the island). Parking is provided directly underneath each building. It was a quick 5-10 minute drive to Old Town by car, and we never had any problems parking when we drove downtown (we used the Hilton garage near Mallory Square, and also there's a convenient lot at the end of Margaret Street near the marina). The lots were never crowded, but this was relatively off-season, so I can't say what parking would be like in high season. But driving and paying the 2 or 3 dollars an hour to park was much easier for us than taking a city bus or the Bone Island Shuttle. Key West is a fun town, especially if you like getting out on the water. We took a great dolphin/snorkel trip with Sheri at Wild About Dolphins, would definitely do it again. Beach House is removed from the craziness of Duval Street and Mallory Square, and that suited us just fine. A lovely place to stay and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: twinzmom
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Key West and the Hyatt was the absolute best thing about our stay. Denise at the front desk greeted us with a smile when we arrived and her smile never waned the whole week. She was the most helpful and friendly person always. The rooms are great with plenty of space and privacy. The screened porch was beautiful as were the grounds. The zero entry pool was fabulous since there is really no beach in all of Key West the pool did the trick for us. We had great neighbors but we werent right on top of them. This is definitely a family friendly place. The view of the sunset is almost as good as the one from Mallory Square.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maartje
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best we had on our trip to Florida: plenty of space for our party of five, luxurious bathroom, well-equipped kitchen, and, something that really made the hotel special to me: it also looked extremely nice and friendly from the outside. The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly, wouldn't mind spending a couple of weeks here! The children loved the pool and the hot tub, not to mention the jaccuzzi!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, suites very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DimbWit
Reviews.Content: The property was very nice, the 2 bedroom suites a much better deal than standard hotel. Full kitchen, washer and dryer, jacuzzi, living room area all provided a wide open feel. The screened porch with ceiling fan and comfortable seating area was a great touch. Just hope you don't have loud neighbors as the neighbors are within a few feet. Don't expect normal hotel services, although housekeepers did clean daily. A great location if fishing and a quick trip from the airport, out away from the crazy Duval street area (but not too far for a visit). All in all a good deal.
